member.name: M:MedicApi.Controllers.ReportsController.GetArticles(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds articles containing disease reports that match the given criteria.

param.name: start_date
param.p: The beginning of the date range to search. Uses the event date in reports to find matching articles. Used in conjunction with end_date (see explanation under end_date).

param.name: end_date
param.p: The end of the date range to search. Uses the event date in reports to find matching articles. Used in conjunction with start_date. Must not be earlier than start_date.

Explanation: The API will search for all events whose date range overlaps with the date given by the range produced by start_date and end_date, and return all articles that contain reports of these events.

param.name: timezone
param.p: The timezone associated with the given start and end date. Must be an unambiguous timezone abbreviation or timezone name from this list.

Explanation: Suppose start_time is 2020-03-23T00:00:00, end_time is 2020-03-23T23:59:59, and timezone is AEDT. The API will search for all events that occurred while it was March 23 2020 in the AEDT timezone.

param.name: key_terms
param.p: The list of key terms to search for in a comma-separated string. All articles returned will match at least one of the given terms. Leave blank to retrieve all articles matching other specified criteria.

param.name: location
param.p: The name of the location to search for. All articles returned will contain a report that references either the specified location or a sub-location within the specified location. Leave blank to retrieve articles matching other specified criteria.

param.name: max
param.p: The maximum number of matching articles to be returned (maximum: 50). If the number of matching articles is greater than max, the first max of those articles will be returned. Must be a positive integer.

param.name: offset
param.p: The number of matching articles to skip. Must be a non-negative integer.

Explanation: Suppose max is 3, and the matching articles are numbered 0 through to 9. If offset is 0 or not specified, articles 0, 1 and 2 will be returned. If offset is 3, articles 3, 4 and 5 will be returned. If offset is 9, only article 9 will be returned.

member.name: M:MedicApi.Controllers.ReportsController.GetCases(System.String)
member.summary: Provides the daily cases data extracted from a specified article, if available.
member.param: The URL of the desired article

member.name: T:MedicApi.Swashbuckle.SwaggerExampleValue
member.summary: A custom attribute for setting default parameter values in Swagger. Decorate the desired API endpoint '[SwaggerExampleValue(name, value)]'.

member.name: T:MedicApi.Swashbuckle.AddExampleValues
member.summary: A Swashbuckle filter that applies the default values. Add 'c.OperationFilter/' to AddSwaggerGen in Startup
